entry.title: 生活里有哪些最简单的快乐？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

Which of the simple pleasures in life do you most enjoy?

Kanwal Anuvind · Social Addict.

 121.8k Views · 9.4k Upvotes

Ten small things that make a big difference.

  1. Listening to good music and getting goose bumps.
  2. Opening a book right where I left.
  3. Getting my scalp rubbed by someone.
  4. Waking up and finding that it rained outside.
  5. Taking a shower at the ideal temperature, right from the start.
  6. Catching an apple someone tossed at me.
  7. Drawing a perfect circle without a compass.
  8. Finding someone with whom I can talk to, and sit in silence, for hours without getting bored.
  9. Having the first sip of a beverage I really like.
  10. Writing this list and realising that readers would relate to most things.

2. 中英译文

Which of the simple pleasures in life do you most enjoy?

生活里有哪些最简单的快乐？_Quora文选

Ten small things that make a big difference.
十件小事却能带来巨大改变。

  • Listening to good music and getting goose bumps.
    听到能让你起鸡皮疙瘩的好音乐时。

  • Opening a book right where I left.
    打开书，正好是在我上次读到的地方。

  • Getting my scalp rubbed by someone.
    当有人轻轻按摩我的头皮时。

  • Waking up and finding that it rained outside.
    醒来发现外面下雨了。

  • Taking a shower at the ideal temperature, right from the start.
    一打开淋浴，就是理想温度的水，不冷不热。

  • Catching an apple someone tossed at me.
    接住别人扔给我的苹果。

  • Drawing a perfect circle without a compass.
    不用圆规就能画出一个完美的圆。

  • Finding someone with whom I can talk to, and sit in silence, for hours without getting bored.
    找到一个可以谈天说地，也可以静静坐着几个小时而不觉得尴尬的人。

  • Having the first sip of a beverage I really like.
    拿到我特别喜欢的饮料，当喝到第一口时。

  • Writing this list and realising that readers would relate to most things.
    写下这份清单，并意识到读者会对大多数事情产生共鸣时。

entry.title: 关于友谊的最佳短篇故事是什么？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

1. English

What is the best short story on friendship?

Yogesh Krishnani ( યોગેશ ક્રિષ્નાણી ) · Lives in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India (1991–present)

​ 209.8K views · 12.6k Upvotes

This happened in the winter of 2014.

My sister was getting married on 15th December and on the same day one of our friend from college was also getting married. And both the functions were in different cities and about 400 km away.

I deliberately didn’t give invitation card to any of my college friends as I wanted everyone to go and attend our classmate’s marriage.

The day came. My sister got married. Now in the middle of our function at night what I see two of my best college friends were there.

How did they manage to come ? As They were in different city on the same day.

They left as soon as marriage of my friend got over, took the train. They asked one of my office friend about address of our marriage hall. And in the winter night when the temperature was below 10 degrees. They came riding on bike just to attend marriage of my sister without any invitation.

That feeling was inexpressible.

Lesson learnt -

Sometimes you don’t need an invitation card!

2. 中英译文

What is the best short story on friendship?
关于友谊的最佳短篇故事是什么？_Quora文选

This happened in the winter of 2014.
这是2014年冬天发生的事。

My sister was getting married on 15th December and on the same day one of our friends from college was also getting married. And both the functions were in different cities and about 400 km away.
我的妹妹在12月15日那天结婚，而我们的一个大学同学也在同一天结婚。而且这两个婚礼在不同的城市，相隔大约400公里。

I deliberately didn’t give an invitation card to any of my college friends as I wanted everyone to go and attend our classmate’s marriage.
我特意没有给任何一个大学朋友发请柬，因为我希望大家都能去参加我们同学的婚礼。

The day came. My sister got married. Now in the middle of our function at night what I saw were two of my best college friends.
那天如期而至，我妹妹结婚了。那天晚上，在我们的婚宴中途，我居然看到了我的两个最好的大学朋友。

How did they manage to come? As they were in a different city on the same day.
他们是怎么赶来的呢？因为他们那天原本在另一个城市。

They left as soon as the marriage of my friend got over, took the train. They asked one of my office friends about the address of the marriage hall. And in the winter night when the temperature was below 10 degrees, they came riding on a bike just to attend the marriage of my sister without any invitation.
他们在我朋友的婚礼一结束就赶紧搭乘火车，他们向我的一位同事打听了婚宴的地址。而在气温低于10度的冬夜里，他们骑着摩托车赶来，只为了参加我妹妹的婚礼，尽管没有受到邀请。

That feeling was inexpressible.
那种感觉是无法用言语表达的。

Lesson learnt-
得到的教训就是：

Sometimes you don’t need an invitation card!
有时候，你根本不需要请柬！

不过，你妹妹结个婚，为嘛要给同学请柬呢？

entry.title: 让生活更轻松的最佳方法是什么？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注”Quora文选”公众号

1. English

What are the best ways to make your life easier?

Piyush · Avid thinker

​ 66.9K views · 2.1k Upvotes

  1. If you can’t make it to something, let the person know ASAP.
  2. Date in private, love in private & rebuild yourself in private.
  3. If a narrow minded or ignorant person says “1+1 = 5”. Don’t correct them, let them enjoy & leave. Life is too short.
  4. Change your personality according to situation. Play dumb, badass or wise according to situation.
  5. If someone is shouting at you in anger, put your hands in pocket, smile & then walk away. Don’t wrestle with a pig, unless situation demands.
  6. Learn to say “I don’t know” or “I was wrong”.
  7. Cleanse your social media from people that bring up negative emotions.
  8. Use Night mode in mobile to avoid having your screen throw off your circadian rhythms.
  9. Engage in mindfulness and meditation.
  10. Set the bar high for yourself & focus on that.
  11. Consume good content before sleeping & after awakening (Not motivational).
  12. Outside is outside leave it there no one pays rent in your mind. What others do or say is their reflection. Don’t think about others. Your Ex is drinking wine with someone else now. Move on.
  13. Avoid foods that drain your energy.

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗔𝗦𝗔𝗣 /ˌeɪˌɛsˌeɪˈpiː, ˌeɪˌɛsˌeɪˈpi/
abbr. 尽快 (as soon as possible)
Please send me the report ASAP.（请尽快把报告发给我。）

2️⃣ 𝗰𝗶𝗿𝗰𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗮𝗻 /sɜːˈkeɪdiən, sɜrˈkeɪdiən/
adj. 昼夜节律的
Circadian rhythms affect our sleep patterns.（昼夜节律影响我们的睡眠模式。）

3️⃣ 𝗿𝗵𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗺𝘀 /ˈrɪðəmz, ˈrɪðəmz/
n. 节奏，韵律
The rhythms of the music were very captivating.（音乐的节奏非常迷人。）

2. 中英译文

What are the best ways to make your life easier?
让生活更轻松的最佳方法是什么？_Quora文选

  • If you can’t make it to something, let the person know ASAP.
    如果你不能参加某个活动，请尽快告知对方。

  • Date in private, love in private & rebuild yourself in private.
    私下约会，私下恋爱，私下重塑自己。

  • If a narrow minded or ignorant person says “1+1 = 5”. Don’t correct them, let them enjoy & leave. Life is too short.
    如果一个心胸狭隘或无知的人说"1+1=5"，不要纠正他们，让他们自得其乐然后离开，人生苦短，没必要去跟他们较真。

  • Change your personality according to situation. Play dumb, badass or wise according to situation.
    根据情况改变你的性格，适时装傻、装得强硬或变得智慧。

  • If someone is shouting at you in anger, put your hands in pocket, smile & then walk away. Don’t wrestle with a pig, unless situation demands.
    如果有人对你愤怒地大喊，把手插进口袋，微笑，然后走开。不要与猪摔跤，除非情况需要。

  • Learn to say “I don’t know” or “I was wrong”.
    学会说"我不知道"或"我错了"。

  • Cleanse your social media from people that bring up negative emotions.
    清理社交媒体上那些带来负面情绪的人。

  • Use Night mode in mobile to avoid having your screen throw off your circadian rhythms.
    使用手机的夜间模式，以避免屏幕干扰你的生物钟。

  • Engage in mindfulness and meditation.
    进行正念和冥想。

  • Set the bar high for yourself & focus on that.
    为自己设定高标准，并专注于此。

  • Consume good content before sleeping & after awakening (Not motivational).
    在睡前和醒后阅读优质内容（非励志类、非成功学）。

  • Outside is outside leave it there no one pays rent in your mind. What others do or say is their reflection. Don’t think about others. Your Ex is drinking wine with someone else now. Move on.
    外面的事情就留在外面，没人会在你的心里付房租。别人做什么或说什么是他们的反映，不要去想别人，你的前任现在正在和别人喝酒，所以要继续前行。

  • Avoid foods that drain your energy.
    避免那些消耗你能量的食物。

1. English

What is the best lesson you learnt from life?

Deepa Thakur · Former Student

​ 608.9K views · 13.8k Upvotes

There’s a maid in our hostel. Everyday I greet her with a smile. Even this morning, I said, “ Good morning Aunty, how are you?”

She looked at me but did not reply anything. I got angry. But as I was about to leave the mess, I asked her, “Aunty… Is everything alright? You look sad today.” She sat in a chair and I sat beside her. There the story started.

She said, “My husband is admitted in hospital for the last three days and I am unable to take leave from my work as my payment will be deducted and I am in need of money right now. In 2010, he fought against paralysis and it took 1.5 lakhs rupees for his treatment. Now again he has piles. He underwent an operation for this last month but the blood is coming out from the stool again. The doctors are unable to find out the main reason for this and they can’t do anything until the bleeding stops.” She shared all her problems with me for almost half an hour and I was listening to it silently.

Hearing all these my eyes filled with tears.

Deep inside, I was feeling guilty as I could not do anything for her. I promised myself that one day I will make myself so capable that I could help at least one person in need. I only said everything will be alright aunty. Keep faith in God!”

Then, she smiled as she spoke her heart out to me. She was relaxed now and said, “ Thank you for listening beta. I am feeling good now.”

So, this incident made me realize that sometimes all you can do for someone is lending your ears attentively. It does help a lot.

Everyone you meet is fighting a battle. You never know what pain they are going through.

Be kind always!

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗱𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁 /dɪˈdʌkt, dɪˈdʌkt/
v. 扣除，减去
The company will deduct taxes from your salary.（公司将从你的工资中扣除税款。）

2️⃣ 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗽𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀 /hæv paɪlz, hæv paɪlz/
phrase. 患痔疮
He couldn’t sit comfortably because he has piles.（他因为患痔疮而无法舒适地坐下。）

3️⃣ 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗼𝗹 /stuːl, stul/
n. 凳子；大便
The doctor asked for a stool sample.（医生要求提供一个大便样本。）

2. 中英译文

What is the best lesson you learnt from life?
你从生活中学到了最好的教训是什么？_Quora文选

There’s a maid in our hostel. Everyday I greet her with a smile. Even this morning, I said, “ Good morning Aunty, how are you?”
我们招待所里有一位女佣，每天我都会微笑着问候她。今天早上我也对她说：“早上好，大娘，您今天好吗？”

She looked at me but did not reply anything. I got angry. But as I was about to leave the mess, I asked her, “Aunty… Is everything alright? You look sad today.” She sat in a chair and I sat beside her. There the story started.
她看了我一眼，但没有回话，我很生气。不过在我要离开餐厅时，我问她：“大娘，您还好吗？今天您看起来很忧郁。”她坐在一把椅子上，我坐在她旁边，故事就从这里开始了：

She said, “ My husband is admitted in hospital for the last three days and I am unable to take leave from my work as my payment will be deducted and I am in need of money right now. In 2010, he fought against paralysis and it took 1.5 lakhs rupees for his treatment. Now again he has piles. He underwent an operation for this last month but the blood is coming out from the stool again. The doctors are unable to find out the main reason for this and they can’t do anything until the bleeding stops.” She shared all her problems with me for almost half an hour and I was listening to it silently.
她说：“我丈夫已经住院三天了，但我无法请假，否则工资会被扣，而我现在正需要钱。2010年，他曾与瘫痪抗争，花了十五万卢比治疗。现在他又得了痔疮。上个月做了手术，但现在又有便血。医生查不出主要原因，直到出血停止前他们什么也做不了。”她与我倾诉了将近半个小时，我默默地听着。

Hearing all these my eyes filled with tears.
听完这些，我眼里满含泪水。

Deep inside, I was feeling guilty as I could not do anything for her. I promised myself that one day I will make myself so capable that I could help at least one person in need. I only said everything will be alright aunty. Keep faith in God!”
在内心深处，我感到内疚，因为我无能为力。我对自己承诺，总有一天我要让自己变得足够强大，至少能帮助一个有需要的人。我只能说：“一切都会好的，大娘妈，要相信上帝！”

Then, she smiled as she spoke her heart out to me. She was relaxed now and said, “ Thank you for listening beta. I am feeling good now.”
然后，她微笑着向我倾诉了心声。她现在轻松了许多，说道：“谢谢你听我说，孩子，我现在感觉好多了。”

So, this incident made me realize that sometimes all you can do for someone is lending your ears attentively. It does help a lot.
这件事让我意识到，有时候我们能为别人做的只是耐心倾听，这确实帮助很大。

Everyone you meet is fighting a battle. You never know what pain they are going through.
每一个你遇见的人都在与自己的生活拼搏，你永远不知道他们正在经历怎样的痛苦。

Be kind always!
要永远善良！

entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What is your best everyday tip?

Sean Kernan ·

​ 175.7K views · 6.9k Upvotes

Get some damn sleep!

Seriously. Why do you keep torturing yourself? I go to sleep 9 hours before I need to wake up. That gives me time to fall asleep.

Your body is designed to like routine. So if it is Friday or Saturday, that doesn’t mean stay up till 4 am just because you can. It’ll take till Wednesday to feel normal.

When I made a commitment to get sleep every night, my life improved drastically; my mood, my academic and athletic performance all went through the roof.

Do you really want to slump through life fatigued? Is that the life you want? Everything sucks when you are tired.

The trick to falling asleep: you have to pretend to be asleep in order to fall asleep. (don’t think, turn your mind off) White noise helps too.

Stop taking naps. And turn these electronics off! They are like crack!

If you are reading this right now and it’s past your “bedtime”, do yourself a favor and turn your phone off and get some sleep, kid!

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 /kəˈmɪtmənt, kəˈmɪtmənt/
n. 承诺，保证
He made a commitment to finish the project by the end of the month.（他承诺在月底前完成这个项目。）

2️⃣ 𝗱𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 /ˈdræstɪkli, ˈdræstɪkli/
adv. 大幅度地，剧烈地
The company’s profits have drastically increased this year.（公司的利润今年大幅度增长。）

3️⃣ 𝗴𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗼𝗼𝗳 /ɡəʊ θruː ðə ruːf, ɡoʊ θru ðə ruf/
phr. 急剧上升，暴涨
Prices of essential commodities have gone through the roof.（必需品的价格已经暴涨。）

4️⃣ 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗰𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗸 /laɪk kræk, laɪk kræk/
phr. 上瘾
She says that new TV show is like crack; she can’t stop watching it.（她说那部新电视剧就像毒品一样让人上瘾，她停不下来。）

2. 中英译文

What is your best everyday tip?
你最好的日常建议是什么？_Quora文选

Get some damn sleep!
快去给好好睡个睡觉！

Seriously. Why do you keep torturing yourself? I go to sleep 9 hours before I need to wake up. That gives me time to fall asleep.
说真的，你为什么要这样折磨自己？我总是在需要起床前9小时上床睡觉，这样能让我有足够的睡眠时间。

Your body is designed to like routine. So if it is Friday or Saturday, that doesn’t mean stay up till 4 am just because you can. It’ll take till Wednesday to feel normal.
你的身体喜欢规律的生活，因此，即使是周五或周六，也不要因为能熬夜就待到凌晨4点，如果这样的话要到星期三才能恢复正常。

When I made a commitment to get sleep every night, my life improved drastically; my mood, my academic and athletic performance all went through the roof.
当我决定每天都保证充足的睡眠时，我的生活发生了巨大的改善；我的情绪、学术和运动表现都显著提升。

Do you really want to slump through life fatigued? Is that the life you want? Everything sucks when you are tired.
你真的想疲惫不堪地度过一生吗？那是你想要的生活吗？当你疲倦时，一切都会变得糟糕。

The trick to falling asleep: you have to pretend to be asleep in order to fall asleep. (don’t think, turn your mind off) White noise helps too.
入睡的诀窍：你必须假装自己已经入睡才能真的入睡。（不要思考，让你的大脑放空）白噪音也很有帮助。

Stop taking naps. And turn these electronics off! They are like crack!
别再零散地打盹儿了，把这些电子设备关掉！它们就像毒品！

If you are reading this right now and it’s past your “bedtime”, do yourself a favor and turn your phone off and get some sleep, kid!
如果你现在正在读这段话，而且已经过了你的“就寝时间”，帮自己一个忙，把手机关掉去睡觉吧，孩子！

1. English

What was one experience in your life that hardened you as a person?

Gaurav Madaan · Amateur Stand up comedian, Musician, Software Engineer

My husband of 28 years came home early from work one day, sat down at the table and told me he was just fired for having an affair with a 25 year old girl at work.

In that moment, with that one sentence, everything inside me shut down and I was in shock, numb.

Until then, I had truly believed he was my best friend and I was a lucky woman.

We ended up losing our dream home, went bankrupt, sold everything of value and cashed out our retirement to survive (I have a good job but his salary was 4x’s mine).

We now live in a small apartment like we did when we first got married.


Those are just “things” though.

What hurts most is how it affected the future of our (then) teen children. We couldn’t help them through college or keep them on health, dentist, and car insurance. All for a few quick fucks.

He is extremely remorseful and worked long and hard to win my heart back. Our marriage counselor considers us a huge success story. I have forgiven him and all seems happy now. But secretly, whatever it was that went numb inside me on May 6th at that breakfast table, has never come back to me. I’m afraid it never will.

I hope if you are married, or even happily employed, that this post will make you think twice should you need to.

entry.title: 保持一颗好奇心有多重要
entry.content:
保持一颗好奇心有多重要

新时代的文盲

在这个AI时代，有大量的人没在用AI，吴恩达教授说，这恐怕就是新时代的文盲

我好奇地问他们，期望了解他们是如何思考的

后来我才发现，人们宁愿持续重复做一项事情，每次做这项任务，成本可能是3小时，而他会觉得自己学习一个东西要花10个小时甚至更多。

就这样，选择一直重复劳作，一直难以投入新事物的学习

也正因如此，他要学的东西开始积压，越来越多

当他意识到自己要被淘汰的时候，想去学习了，发现原来要搞明白很多事情，要投入比之前更多的精力成本

这时候可能就只能放弃，学不动，也没活儿干，然后只能跑腿送外卖

好奇心驱动

相反，那些持续学习的人，并不是因为他们有多么强的学习能力，而是好奇心驱动

好奇有没有更好的办法达到更好的效果，好奇新鲜事物和未来的东西，这些往往带来了较多的动力持续进步

每次要学的内容增量其实就会逐渐变小，以更快的理解力获取内容

我举个例子，

如果你是一个经常学习的人，有一个系统教程给你，你不会从头开始看的，你会意识到自己需要看哪里，然后挑选去看

但如果什么都没接触过的人，他就会选择从头开始，甚至学几下可能就放弃了，因为前面都是概念，没有任何正反馈，无法实操也无法看到结果

这就是持续学习，和积攒知识负债后再启动学习之间的差异

但好奇心这个东西，往往与生俱来，人们最好能找到自己喜欢的那个事情，从那个切口去接触AI

  • 比如你喜欢写作，你就从写作中接触AI，怎么让AI有能力写的比你还要好
  • 比如你喜欢游戏，你就从游戏中接触AI，是不是可以构建一个关于泰拉瑞亚的Agents问答助手，从此不需要在搜索wiki
  • 比如你喜欢运动，你有没有想过如何用AI来辅助你提升运动质量

这些切入点，往往比什么「AI焦虑症」更能让你主动的开始

Then my Dad came to me and asked me why didn’t I have lunch.

I told him that I had food with my friends and didn’t want to have food cooked by Mom as I fought with her.

He listened to what I said and then said to me , ‘You know, I sometimes don’t like what your Mom says or what she does but have you seen me shouting at her or fighting with her ?’

I said, ‘No.’

He said, ‘If you or me or your sister fight with your Mom then we can go out with our friends or colleagues and have food, chill out and come back whenever we want. But have you ever thought of your Mom after you shout at her? She will sit there and think for the whole day why you shouted at her and she will not have food for the whole day. So think before you shout at her or fight with her, you have a whole world outside waiting to hangout with you but for her you, your sister and I are her world and when any one of us shout at her, then her whole world gets wrecked. For you it’s just a matter of few seconds of anger so if you can suppress it for sometime, you can make her world a happy one. ‘

I honestly try not to shout or fight with my Mom anytime after that or even if I fight with her I make sure I apologise as quickly as possible.

我浏览了所有的布告栏，寻找能告诉我教室信息的东西。终于，我找到了我的教室并走了过去，身后有一个女孩也正在爬楼梯。

We both were first to enter the lecture hall. I turned to find the switch board but it was on her side, so I just requested her to switch on light. There were many switches on the board. She observed those switches for few seconds and flipped a switch and the lights were on.
我们俩是第一批进入讲堂的，我转身去寻找开关板，但都在她那边，所以我请她打开一下灯。开关板上有很多开关，她观察了几秒钟，按了一个开关，灯就亮了。

I asked her “how did you know that which was the switch for lights amongst so many switches”? She said “the ones near the regulator are generally fan switch and I observed rest all the switch and only three were having signs of wear and tear, hence they were used frequently. So I had to select from only three and there are three tubelights so I guess all the three were light switches. “
我问她：“你是怎么知道这么多开关中哪个是灯的开关的？”她说：“靠近调节器的通常是风扇开关，我观察了其余所有的开关，只有三个有磨损的痕迹，因此它们被频繁使用。所以我只需从这三个中选择，而这里有三根日光灯管，所以我猜这三个都是灯的开关。”

She flipped other two and guess what? she was correct.
她开了另外两个开关，结果你猜怎么着？她全都对了。

Common sense is not so common.
常识并不常见。

“If you sit home playing video games all day, you won’t meet anyone.”

I was 49 years old, and had never been married. In fact, I had barely dated as an adult. I’d had one relationship, when I was 23–24 years old, that lasted 18 months, and another when I was 36 that lasted six months. And after that, I just never had much interest in trying to find romance and love. I took the position, “if it happens, it happens”.

So, living alone in an apartment, at 49 years old, I spent most of my time alone, playing World of Warcraft, when I wasn’t at work. Work and WoW, that was my life.


So on Christmas Eve, 2015, I was sitting alone in my apartment, playing WoW. At some point in the evening, I wandered downstairs to my kitchen, and as I was entering the kitchen, I noticed for the first time a small, patched section on the wall. I was curious about it. You see, my apartment building was built some time before World War 2. I had already figured out that, when the building was new, it was heated by some kind of furnace in the basement, with all of the apartments sharing the heat. I figured that this small, square, patched-over spot must have originally been some kind of vent that allowed the air to move between apartments. My curiosity prompted me to knock on it.

Somebody knocked back.

So I knocked again, and heard more knocks in return. Then I heard a woman’s voice through the wall yelling, “Hey, come over here!”

I was … a bit surprised. But I shrugged and went over there.

I met my neighbor for the first time. We spent the rest of Christmas Eve together. Then we spent Christmas together. And the next day. And the next, and the next. She had a big TV, but no cable, so she could only use it to watch DVDs. I set her TV up with my WiFi password so that she could use my Netflix account. I spent most evenings in her apartment, watching shows on Netflix with her.


In March 2016, she moved into my apartment, and toward the end of April, we got married.

I was playing video games instead of looking for love, but love found me :)

What was the shortest interview you’ve had that led to a job offer?

Kanwal Anuvind · 100+ interviews and counting University

 215.1k Views · 21.3k Upvotes

It was an interview for an internship during the summer of 2014.

Background: I sent in my application for an internship in Product Management at a mid-sized IT company. All the applicants were asked to complete an assignment before they could be invited for an interview. I received a call from the hiring manager 30 minutes after I emailed him my assignment. He only asked two questions. The first being, “Why did you convert your PowerPoint Presentation to PDF?”.

“I have used the font Trade Gothic. It is more visually appealing than Arial or Times New Roman. I was not sure if you’d have the font pack on your system. If you didn’t, all the text would lose the formatting. I didn’t want to take risk”, I said.

“Can you come from Monday?”, was the last question I was asked. Apparently, forward-looking approach is an integral part of Product Management!


Jason Harrison · Studied at Simon Fraser University

​ 457K views · 41.1k Upvotes

Not me. But my father.

Went for an interview as a restaurant server. The interview was at 8:00am.

He got there early, and was the only person in the waiting room.

At 7:05 the manager came out and said “are you Steve? For the 7:00am interview?”

He replied “No. Bill. For 8:00am”

“You’re hired”.

Background: I sent in my application for an internship in Product Management at a mid-sized IT company. 背景：我申请了一家中型IT公司的产品管理实习职位。所有申请者都被要求完成一个任务，才能获得面试机会。在我将这个任务通过电子邮件发送给招聘经理后，仅仅过了30分钟，我就接到了他的电话。他只问了两个问题，第一个是：“你为什么把PowerPoint演示文稿转换成PDF？”

“I have used the font Trade Gothic. It is more visually appealing than Arial or Times New Roman. I was not sure if you’d have the font pack on your system. If you didn’t, all the text would lose the formatting. I didn’t want to take risk”, I said.

“Can you come from Monday?”, was the last question I was asked. Apparently, forward-looking approach is an integral part of Product Management!
“你能下周一开始上班吗？”这是他问我的最后一个问题。显然，前瞻性的思维方式是产品管理的重要组成部分！

第二篇回答

Not me. But my father.
不是我，而是我的父亲的故事。

Went for an interview as a restaurant server. The interview was at 8:00am.
他去应聘餐厅服务员，面试时间定在早上八点。

He got there early, and was the only person in the waiting room.
他提前到了，是唯一一个在等候室里的人。

At 7:05 the manager came out and said “are you Steve? For the 7:00am interview?”
七点零五分，经理出来问道：“你是Steve吗？来参加七点的面试？”

He replied “No. Bill. For 8:00am”
他回答说：“不，我叫Bill，是来参加八点的面试。”

“You’re hired”.
“你被录用了。”

entry.title: 变富就是每天循环这13个动作（摘录）
entry.content:
变富就是每天循环这13个动作

摘自X大佬的分享

1、每天培养自己的输出能力

一个人，要是天天写800字，就算没有文笔，坚持半年也能文采飞扬; 一个人，坚持每天拍3条视频，就算口齿再差，拍3个月也能滔滔不绝。

2、凡事从积极点出发

“我可付不起”带来的悲哀和无助感会使人们失望、迟钝以至意志消沉。“我怎样才能付得起”则打开了充满可能性的快乐和梦想之门。

3、提升销售能力

做任何事情都要有销售能力，比如你找投资人要钱，其实就是在销售你自己和你的项目，你找公司面试也是在销售你自己。所以如果你现在没钱

4、永远保密三件事

你的感情状态，你的情绪和你要做的事情。

5、先完成再完美

从脑科学角度而言，“放弃追求完美”才能实现“立刻行动”。下调目标才能让工作速度一下子“飞”起来，不要对自己期待过高，平常心对待。

6、一定培养耐心

无论种树栽花都需要时间成长，赚钱也是一样的，要有开花结果的过程，不要想着一蹴而就，总是换项目，没有熟悉没有等到时机,顶多赚点小钱。

7、永远清晰人和人的关系

人和人之间只存在一种关系，那就是利益关系。要么你能满足别人的情绪价值，如情感、关怀、快乐等价值，要么你能给别人带来利益价值，如资源或者金钱。不在烂事上纠缠，不为不值得的人生气，让自己活得高贵一点，会放下烂人烂事。

8、赚钱就是循环三件事

循环发文字/音频/视频引流，再去发卖点和客户反馈，持续服务客户，就是每天循环这三件事，每天循环收钱。

9、只吃七分饱

饱暖思淫欲，吃饱了你就想睡觉，也容易犯困，人只有在未满足的情况下才有干劲，吃饭只吃七分饱，也是让自己提高效率最简单的办法。

10、永远不要为了爱慕虚荣而乱花钱

存款才是你最大的底气，趁着年轻早点提升自己的多能力，为梦想去积累资本，早日拥有选择的自由。

11、练习专注

好的商业模式一定是简单的，一个人做的事情越多，越不容易赚钱；一个人脑子越复杂，赚钱也就越困难；一个人处事越简单，赚钱也变得简单。

12、永远不抱怨

一个人成熟的标志，就是把这件事为什么发生在我身上的怨念，转变成这件事是为了教会我什么的觉醒。当你换个角度看世界，你会发现一切都是最好的安排，凡是从利益的角度去衡量、去思考，你就会变得越来越聪明。

13、勤能补拙不是空谈

接触到的大佬，早起晚睡很勤奋，什么节假日国庆春节还在死嗑。创业的时候也没有节假日，五一也忙到凌晨，所以我觉得勤奋还是必要的。
